moves.2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3: Najdorf... I'll have to renew it soon
moves.6. Be3: i thought it was going to be a calm one
moves.6... Bd7 7. f3: everything surprises me in this game
moves.7... e6 8. g4: the white king has decided to expose himself
moves.8... h6 9. Qd2 Nc6 10. O-O-O: Here is my first mistake: i thought white would not attack on the side where the king hid
moves.11. Nb3 Qc7 12. h4 O-O-O: I thought that I could hide here
moves.13. Na4: but then I saw my mistake!!!
moves.14. Nb6+: and white found a better move
moves.15... Kc8: Already hoping for a draw... but of course I knew white had better options
moves.16. Bb6: logical move... the first apparent answer would be to save the rook, but then comes the savage Nxd6... anyway, here white could have made many things I was afraid of.
moves.16... d5: I decided to give me fresh air at the price of my rook
moves.18. Bxf6 Qc7: Of course not gxf, followed by mate on d7
moves.19. Bxc4 gxf6: so now white has the quality AND a pawn. I may have resigned, but I wanted to play.
moves.20. Qe3: preparing Nc5 or/and doubling the rooks.
moves.20... h5: threatening Bh6, with the real prospect to "give air".
moves.21. g5 fxg5 22. hxg5: feeling already better and viewing some kind of possibilities, now...Can you believe it? I was already hoping for...
moves.22... Bd6: ... planning to recuperate at least my pawn
moves.24. Qc5 Ne5 25. Qxc7+ Kxc7: and now threatening to take back another pawn...
moves.26. Nc5: not anymore: if Nxf3, loses the Bd7
moves.28. Nd3 Nxd3 29. Rxd3: white really seems better, still, and with a little bit of patience, would have won. But white disregards h5-4-3...
moves.30... Bc6: considering it well: white has no obvious attack here. But once again, with a little bit of patience, going back to Rh1, R3d1, Bf1...
moves.31... h3: I can't let him breathe anymore.
moves.32. b4: a little bit late for that
moves.32... b5: and now, the clear white bishop is passive for a good while.
moves.33. Bb3 h2: and the black threat is more and more real
moves.34. c3: trying to get the bishop back in the game
moves.35... Rg3: yep! this is the clear one! If Rxh2, then Rg1+ gains the rook
moves.36. Rdd1: and this is necessary to avoid Rg1+ with the protection of the pawn...
moves.36... Rxf3: one more pawn inside... and protecting the pawn h2 again
moves.37. Rde1: I expected him to protec c3.
moves.37... Rxc3: well, i see no reason not to take it.
moves.38. Re2 f5: I didn't consider Rh3: the pawn h2 has played its role and cannot be dangerous anymore. The central pawn, on the other side...
moves.39. Rhxh2 Bxh2 40. Rxh2: and now, the favor is reversed: i have one pawn
moves.44. Kb2 Ke5 45. Kb3 Kf4 46. a4: hm... have i been so naive in the past?
white resigns. I have been lucky and/or white has been too optimistic around move 22. I liked the game, because it tought me a lot of things about the power of pawns and bishops.
